Name: Kushites
History: The Kushites are an African kingdom known for its vast wealth, so they start a standard match with an extra free metal mine near their Civic Center. Their archers are excellent and their units are fast-moving, but have low armor. They build Meroitic Pyramids, which increase the territory influence of their settlements and they have access to fast light war elephants.

Factions.Name: Kushite Africans
Factions.Description: The Kingdom of Kush was an ancient African kingdom situated on the confluences of the Blue Nile, White Nile and River Atbara in what is now the Republic of Sudan. The Kushite era of rule in the region was established after the Bronze Age collapse of the New Kingdom of Egypt, and it was centered at Napata in its early phase. They invaded Egypt in the 8th century BC, and the Kushite emperors ruled as Pharaohs of the Twenty-fifth dynasty of Egypt for a century, until they were expelled by the Assyrians. Kushite culture was influenced heavily by the Egyptians, with Kushite pyramid building and monumental temple architecture still extent. The Kushites even worshipped many Egyptian gods, including Amun. During Classical antiquity, the Kushite imperial capital was at Meroe. In early Greek geography, the Meroitic kingdom was known as Aethiopia. The Kushite kingdom persisted until the 4th century AD, when it weakened and disintegrated due to internal rebellion, eventually succumbing to the rising power of Axum.

Technologies.Name: Cattlemen
Technologies.Description: Batches of domestic Cattle train much faster.

Technologies.Name: Fervor for Amun
Technologies.Description: Napatan Temple Guard +10% attack, +10% attack rate, and +10% movement speed.

Technologies.Name: Apedemak's Faithful
Technologies.Description: Meroe Temple Guard +10% attack, +10% attack rate, and +10% movement speed.

Technologies.Name: Royal Archers
Technologies.Description: Upgrade Noble Archers to Royal Archers, who have +2 all armor, but +25% metal cost.

Technologies.Name: Royal Cavalry
Technologies.Description: Upgrade Noble Cavalry to Royal Cavalry, who have +2 all armor, but +25% metal cost.

Technologies.Name: Warrior Queen
Technologies.Description: Female Heroes +10% attack, nearly 100% bow accuracy.

CivBonuses.Name: The Pyramids of Meroe
CivBonuses.Description: Building a Kushite pyramid increases Civic Center territory influence by +10% for each one built.

CivBonuses.Name: Mineral Deposits
CivBonuses.Description: Kushite players receive a free extra Metal Mine somewhere in their home territory.

CivBonuses.Name: Elephant Roundup
CivBonuses.Description: Can capture Gaia elephants and garrison them into a corral to reduce training costs for War Elephants.

TeamBonuses.Name: Iron Mongers
TeamBonuses.History: The Kushites had access to vast amounts of iron ore, and subsequent to learning the craft of iron working from the Assyrians they became exporters of iron goods.
TeamBonuses.Description: Players allied with Kush gain a free slow trickle of the metal resource for each Market the Kushite player builds.

Structures.Name: Temple of Amun
Structures.Special: The Kushites can upgrade individual Temples to Temples of Amun, which can train Napatan Temple Guard champions and heal units faster.

Structures.Name: Temple of Apedemak
Structures.Special: The Kushites can upgrade individual Temples to Temples of Apedemak, which can train Meroe Temple Guard champions and heal units faster.

Structures.Name: Kushite Pyramids
Structures.History: The Kushites built over 200 pyramids in Nubia.
Structures.Special: Building a Small Kushite Pyramid unlocks the Town Phase. Building a Large Kushite Pyramid unlocks the City Phase. And each pyramid built adds +10% territory effect to Civic Centers.
